intro: Cardamine anteniquana, commonly known as the Antilles watercress, is a perennial herb native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a waxy coating. The small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by distinctive, spirally arranged fruits.
